spring_framework:4.3.16 vulnerability, will be fixed as part of RDM-2506 (Upgrade to Spring Boot 2)
spring_framework:4.3.8 vulnerability, will be fixed as part of RDM-2506 (Upgrade to Spring Boot 2)
spring-context-support: 4.3.8 vulnerabiulity, we don't use HiddenHttpMethodFilter so unimpacted
spring-context-support: 4.3.8 vulnerability, we don't use MappingJackson2JsonView or AbstractJsonpResponseBodyAdvice so unimpacted
Temporary suppression while we investigate. See RDM-3324
Temporary suppression to ignore CVE with com.google.guava. See RDM-3372

Temporary suppression of an issue related to the current stable slf4j which is brought in by other dependencies. CCD don't explicitly declare dependencies on slf4j. org.slf4j.ext.EventData in the slf4j-ext module in QOS.CH SLF4J before 1.8.0-beta2 allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions via crafted data. Investigation notes can be found in RDM-3549. slf4j may need to be updated when a future stable version is released
Temporarily suppress spring framework CVE see RDM-3809. Will be removed with RDM-3796 fixes land.
spring-boot-starter-batch 1.5.19 is using spring-batch 3.0.10 which fixes the issue. We also don't use XML source, trusted or not so are unimpacted.
https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/1827
